entry.title: Yulia Lipnitskaya (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that at the 2014 Olympic Games, Yulia Lipnitskaya (pictured) became Russia's youngest-ever Winter Olympic gold medalist?

entry.title: a Utah radio station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a Utah radio station read books to listeners, a Chapter a Day?

entry.title: Maria Luigia Pizzoli (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Italian pianist and composer Maria Luigia Pizzoli posthumously received the title of Maestro di Contrappunto (master of counterpoint)?

entry.title: Larrabee County (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that because Larrabee County was not established, Iowa remains a state with 99 counties?

entry.title: Yazathingyan Nga Mauk (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Yazathingyan Nga Mauk betrayed his brother, Commander Nga Nu, after being promised Nu's wife, Queen Saw Omma, in marriage?

entry.title: climate change in Asia (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that climate change in Asia is expected to increase flood risks in the continent's cities, which are already high for 932 million people?

entry.title: SkyBridge Alternatives Conference (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the SkyBridge Alternatives Conference has been called the "Super Bowl of hedge funds"?

entry.title: a tour (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that after performing a tour, football club Santa Cruz Futebol Clube had four fewer players, two of them being dead?

entry.title: one creationist journal (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that according to one creationist journal, HIV has its origins in the Fall?
